abstract: Pro Football Hall of Fame does not intend to let family of Junior Seau or anyone else speak on his behalf at his induction ceremony and will play video commemorating his career instead; Seau's family has criticized decision, although Hall of Fame officials say it is matter of policy and has nothing to do with Seau's suicide, his subsequent diagnosis of brain injury or fact that family has sued NFL; video will not mention suicide.
lead_paragraph: Junior Seau, a former linebacker, committed suicide in 2012 and had a subsequent diagnosis of traumatic brain injury. Pro football’s Hall of Fame said it had ended speeches for deceased inductees.

headline.main: Junior Seau’s Family Will Not Be Allowed to Speak at His Hall of Fame Induction
headline.print_headline: No Suicide Talk at N.F.L. Function

snippet: Junior Seau, a former linebacker, committed suicide in 2012 and had a subsequent diagnosis of traumatic brain injury. Pro football’s Hall of Fame said it had ended speeches for deceased inductees.
